tool.name: Scatter Plot
tool.command:
scatterPlot.py --input $input --ID $uniqID #if $design and $group --design $design --group $group #end if
--xaxis $xaxis --yaxis $yaxis
#if "$title" --title "$title" #end if
#if $xname --xname $xname #end if #if $yname --yname $yname #end if
--fig $fig

param.name: input
param.label: Stacked Dataset
param.help: Input dataset in wide format and tab separated. If not tab separated see TIP below.

param.name: uniqID
param.label: Sample ID
param.help: Name of the column in your Wide Dataset that has unique compound/gene IDs.

param.name: design
param.label: Metadata File [Optional].
param.help: Metadata file tab separated. Note you need a 'sampleID' column. If not tab separated see TIP below

param.name: group
param.label: Group/Treatment [Optional]
param.help: Name of the column in your Metadata File that contains group classifications.

tool.help:
@TIP_AND_WARNING@
**What it does**
Generates a 2 dimensional scatter plot.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
**Input**
- Two input datasets are required.
@WIDE@
**NOTE:** The sample IDs must match the sample IDs in the Metadata File (below).
@METADATA@
- In addition to your datasets, you need to provide:
**Sample ID**
- The column name in your Tall and Metadata datasets that contains the unique IDs for your samples. In our example dataset you would input *SampleID*.
**Column name with X-value**
- The column name in your Tall dataset that contains the values to be plotted on the X-axis.
**Column name with Y-value**
- The column name in your Tall file that contains the values to be plotted on the Y-axis.
**Plot title** [Optional]
- Optional title to display on your plot
@GROUP_OPTIONAL@
**X-axis label** [Optional]
- Optional x-axis label to display on your plot
**Y-axis label** [Optional]
- Optional y-axis label to display on your plot
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
**Output Files**
- This tool outputs 1 PDF file:
**scatterplot_PDF** is a PDF plot of the selected values.
